feature_title: Plural form for words denoting dual objects
feature_description: In [@ibragimov2004] it is said that in some dialects there are special forms for words denoting dual objects (eyes, legs, etc.), formed from singular absolutive (ul ‘eye’, ʁil ‘leg’) with formant -ab (ulab ‘eyes’, ʁilab ‘legs’). There are also other plural forms: ulabɨr ‘eyes’, ʁilabɨr ‘legs’. We collected forms of these two nouns using three contexts: ‘She has beautiful eyes’, ‘Eyes’ and ‘My legs hurt’. In case of ‘eye’, the first reaction always was the form ulabɨr, and we asked if the form ulab is possible. In the map the results are shown: OK ulab — the form ulab is possible, *ulab — it is impossible. As for ‘leg’, we almost always got the form ʁilabɨr as the first reaction, except for Myukhrek, where the first reaction was ʁilab (but ʁilabɨr is also possible). The results are displayed in the map: OK ʁilab — the form ʁilab is possible, *ʁilab — it is impossible, ʁilab — a label for Myukhrek only, where, unlike other dialects, this form was the first reaction.
name: Сара

feature_description: In [@ibragimov2004] it is said that in some dialects there are special forms for words denoting dual objects (eyes, legs, etc.), formed from singular absolutive (ul ‘eye’, ʁil ‘leg’) with formant -ab (ulab ‘eyes’, ʁilab ‘legs’). There are also other plural forms: ulabɨr ‘eyes’, ʁilabɨr ‘legs’. We collected forms of these two nouns using three contexts: ‘She has beautiful eyes’, ‘Eyes’ and ‘My legs hurt’. In case of ‘eye’, the first reaction always was the form ulabɨr, and we asked if the form ulab is possible. In the map the results are shown: OK ulab — the form ulab is possible, *ulab — it is impossible. As for ‘leg’, we almost always got the form ʁilabɨr as the first reaction, except for Myukhrek, where the first reaction was ʁilab (but ʁilabɨr is also possible). The results are displayed in the map: OK ʁilab — the form ʁilab is possible, *ʁilab — it is impossible, ʁilab — a label for Myukhrek only, where, unlike other dialects, this form was the first reaction.
name: Мухтар
long_periods_outside: 5 лет учился в городе, ездил по всей России на соревнования

As for ‘leg’, we almost always got the form ʁilabɨr as the first reaction, except for Myukhrek, where the first reaction was ʁilab (but ʁilabɨr is also possible). The results are displayed in the map: OK ʁilab — the form ʁilab is possible, *ʁilab — it is impossible, ʁilab — a label for Myukhrek only, where, unlike other dialects, this form was the first reaction.
name: Индира

feature_title: Phonetic differences in the word for ‘goat’
feature_description: This map shows the phonetic variation in absolutive singular form of the word ‘goat’. The form can either cʼihʲ, either cʼij.
name: Сара

feature_description: The singular absolutive form is cʼihʲ or cʼij (see feature @). The plural absolutive form can be regular: cʼiher, cʼihe and cʼijmar (and their phonetic variants), or irregular: cʼuhuler (and its phonetic variants). In some villages only regular forms are present, in some - both of them, and in the rest - the irregular variant is the only variant attested.
name: Сара
value: cʼuhuler / cʼuhulär / cʼɨhɨlar / cʼɨhɨler / cʼühüler / cʼuhular ; cʼiher / cʼihär / cʼeher

name: Фарида

feature_description: The singular absolutive form is cʼihʲ or cʼij (see feature @). The plural absolutive form can be regular: cʼiher, cʼihe and cʼijmar (and their phonetic variants), or irregular: cʼuhuler (and its phonetic variants). In some villages only regular forms are present, in some - both of them, and in the rest - the irregular variant is the only variant attested.
name: Фарида

feature_title: Plural form for words denoting dual objects
feature_description: In [@ibragimov2004] it is said that in some dialects there are special forms for words denoting dual objects (eyes, legs, etc.), formed from singular absolutive (ul ‘eye’, ʁil ‘leg’) with formant -ab (ulab ‘eyes’, ʁilab ‘legs’). There are also other plural forms: ulabɨr ‘eyes’, ʁilabɨr ‘legs’. We collected forms of these two nouns using three contexts: ‘She has beautiful eyes’, ‘Eyes’ and ‘My legs hurt’. In case of ‘eye’, the first reaction always was the form ulabɨr, and we asked if the form ulab is possible. In the map the results are shown: OK ulab — the form ulab is possible, *ulab — it is impossible. As for ‘leg’, we almost always got the form ʁilabɨr as the first reaction, except for Myukhrek, where the first reaction was ʁilab (but ʁilabɨr is also possible). The results are displayed in the map: OK ʁilab — the form ʁilab is possible, *ʁilab — it is impossible, ʁilab — a label for Myukhrek only, where, unlike other dialects, this form was the first reaction.
name: Сара

The results are displayed in the map: OK ʁilab — the form ʁilab is possible, *ʁilab — it is impossible, ʁilab — a label for Myukhrek only, where, unlike other dialects, this form was the first reaction.
name: Фарида

feature_title: Plural form for words denoting dual objects
feature_description: In [@ibragimov2004] it is said that in some dialects there are special forms for words denoting dual objects (eyes, legs, etc.), formed from singular absolutive (ul ‘eye’, ʁil ‘leg’) with formant -ab (ulab ‘eyes’, ʁilab ‘legs’). There are also other plural forms: ulabɨr ‘eyes’, ʁilabɨr ‘legs’. We collected forms of these two nouns using three contexts: ‘She has beautiful eyes’, ‘Eyes’ and ‘My legs hurt’. In case of ‘eye’, the first reaction always was the form ulabɨr, and we asked if the form ulab is possible. feature_description: Ergative marker can be of r-type (balʁu-ra fish.OBL-ERG) or of vowel-type (gagaj-e uncle-ERG). We collected 6 sentences with three nouns in singular and in plural: uncle.SG and uncle.PL (animate, human), fish.SG and fish.PL (animate, non-human), river.SG and rock.PL (inanimate, non-human). The sentences are the following: ‘(My) uncle helped me build a house’, ‘(My) uncles helped me build a house’, ‘The fish (SG) ate the fly’, ‘The fish (PL) ate the flies’, ‘The river demolished the bridge’, ‘The rocks broke the roof’. In these maps the type (r-type or vowel-type) for each context is shown.
name: Сара

feature_description: Ergative marker can be of r-type (balʁu-ra fish.OBL-ERG) or of vowel-type (gagaj-e uncle-ERG). In each case the vowel in the marker can be present (balʁu-ra fish.OBL-ERG, gagaj-e uncle-ERG) or absent (balʁu-r fish.OBL-ERG, gagaj-Ø uncle-ERG). We collected 6 sentences with three nouns in singular and in plural: uncle.SG and uncle.PL (animate, human), fish.SG and fish.PL (animate, non-human), river.SG and rock.PL (inanimate, non-human). The sentences are the following: ‘(My) uncle helped me build a house’, ‘(My) uncles helped me build a house’, ‘The fish (SG) ate the fly’, ‘The fish (PL) ate the flies’, ‘The river demolished the bridge’, ‘The rocks broke the roof’. In these maps the presence of the vowel in ergative marker is shown in these 6 contexts.
name: Сара

feature_description: Ergative marker can be of r-type (balʁu-ra fish.OBL-ERG) or of vowel-type (gagaj-e uncle-ERG). In each case the vowel in the marker can be present (balʁu-ra fish.OBL-ERG, gagaj-e uncle-ERG) or omitted (balʁu-r fish.OBL-ERG, gagaj-Ø uncle-ERG). This feature shows if the opposite variant of first reaction is possible. For example, speaker's first reaction was balʁu-ra (fish.OBL-ERG), then we asked if it is possible to say balʁu-r, or vice versa, speaker's first reaction was balʁu-r (fish.OBL-ERG), then we asked if it is possible to say balʁu-ra. If the opposite variant is possible, then we say there is a variation in vowel presence, if it is not possible, there is no variation. We collected 6 sentences with three nouns in singular and in plural: uncle.SG and uncle.PL (animate, human), fish.SG and fish.PL (animate, non-human), river.SG and rock.PL (inanimate, non-human). The sentences are the following: ‘(My) uncle helped me build a house’, ‘(My) uncles helped me build a house’, ‘The fish (SG) ate the fly’, ‘The fish (PL) ate the flies’, ‘The river demolished the bridge’, ‘The rocks broke the roof’. These maps show whether the variation in vowel presence is attested or not.
name: Сара

We collected 6 sentences with three nouns in singular and in plural: uncle.SG and uncle.PL (animate, human), fish.SG and fish.PL (animate, non-human), river.SG and rock.PL (inanimate, non-human). The sentences are the following: ‘(My) uncle helped me build a house’, ‘(My) uncles helped me build a house’, ‘The fish (SG) ate the fly’, ‘The fish (PL) ate the flies’, ‘The river demolished the bridge’, ‘The rocks broke the roof’. In these maps the type (r-type or vowel-type) for each context is shown.

In each case the vowel in the marker can be present (balʁu-ra fish.OBL-ERG, gagaj-e uncle-ERG) or omitted (balʁu-r fish.OBL-ERG, gagaj-Ø uncle-ERG). This feature shows if the opposite variant of first reaction is possible. For example, speaker's first reaction was balʁu-ra (fish.OBL-ERG), then we asked if it is possible to say balʁu-r, or vice versa, speaker's first reaction was balʁu-r (fish.OBL-ERG), then we asked if it is possible to say balʁu-ra. If the opposite variant is possible, then we say there is a variation in vowel presence, if it is not possible, there is no variation. We collected 6 sentences with three nouns in singular and in plural: uncle.SG and uncle.PL (animate, human), fish.SG and fish.PL (animate, non-human), river.SG and rock.PL (inanimate, non-human). The sentences are the following: ‘(My) uncle helped me build a house’, ‘(My) uncles helped me build a house’, ‘The fish (SG) ate the fly’, ‘The fish (PL) ate the flies’, ‘The river demolished the bridge’, ‘The rocks broke the roof’. These maps show whether the variation in vowel presence is attested or not.
name: Али

In each case the vowel in the marker can be present (balʁu-ra fish.OBL-ERG, gagaj-e uncle-ERG) or absent (balʁu-r fish.OBL-ERG, gagaj-Ø uncle-ERG). We collected 6 sentences with three nouns in singular and in plural: uncle.SG and uncle.PL (animate, human), fish.SG and fish.PL (animate, non-human), river.SG and rock.PL (inanimate, non-human). The sentences are the following: ‘(My) uncle helped me build a house’, ‘(My) uncles helped me build a house’, ‘The fish (SG) ate the fly’, ‘The fish (PL) ate the flies’, ‘The river demolished the bridge’, ‘The rocks broke the roof’. In these maps the presence of the vowel in ergative marker is shown in these 6 contexts.
name: Зейнаб

feature_description: Ergative marker can be of r-type (balʁu-ra fish.OBL-ERG) or of vowel-type (gagaj-e uncle-ERG). This feature shows if the opposite variant of first reaction is possible. For example, speaker's first reaction was balʁu-ra (fish.OBL-ERG), then we asked if it is possible to say balʁu-r, or vice versa, speaker's first reaction was balʁu-r (fish.OBL-ERG), then we asked if it is possible to say balʁu-ra. These maps show whether the variation in vowel presence is attested or not.

In each case the vowel in the marker can be present (balʁu-ra fish.OBL-ERG, gagaj-e uncle-ERG) or omitted (balʁu-r fish.OBL-ERG, gagaj-Ø uncle-ERG). This feature shows if the opposite variant of first reaction is possible. For example, speaker's first reaction was balʁu-ra (fish.OBL-ERG), then we asked if it is possible to say balʁu-r, or vice versa, speaker's first reaction was balʁu-r (fish.OBL-ERG), then we asked if it is possible to say balʁu-ra. If the opposite variant is possible, then we say there is a variation in vowel presence, if it is not possible, there is no variation. We collected 6 sentences with three nouns in singular and in plural: uncle.SG and uncle.PL (animate, human), fish.SG and fish.PL (animate, non-human), river.SG and rock.PL (inanimate, non-human). The sentences are the following: ‘(My) uncle helped me build a house’, ‘(My) uncles helped me build a house’, ‘The fish (SG) ate the fly’, ‘The fish (PL) ate the flies’, ‘The river demolished the bridge’, ‘The rocks broke the roof’. These maps show whether the variation in vowel presence is attested or not.
name: Феруза

In each case the vowel in the marker can be present (balʁu-ra fish.OBL-ERG, gagaj-e uncle-ERG) or omitted (balʁu-r fish.OBL-ERG, gagaj-Ø uncle-ERG). This feature shows if the opposite variant of first reaction is possible. For example, speaker's first reaction was balʁu-ra (fish.OBL-ERG), then we asked if it is possible to say balʁu-r, or vice versa, speaker's first reaction was balʁu-r (fish.OBL-ERG), then we asked if it is possible to say balʁu-ra. If the opposite variant is possible, then we say there is a variation in vowel presence, if it is not possible, there is no variation. We collected 6 sentences with three nouns in singular and in plural: uncle.SG and uncle.PL (animate, human), fish.SG and fish.PL (animate, non-human), river.SG and rock.PL (inanimate, non-human). The sentences are the following: ‘(My) uncle helped me build a house’, ‘(My) uncles helped me build a house’, ‘The fish (SG) ate the fly’, ‘The fish (PL) ate the flies’, ‘The river demolished the bridge’, ‘The rocks broke the roof’. These maps show whether the variation in vowel presence is attested or not.
name: Зияд
answer: гагай зас кумаг выъыр халбыр гьаъас, OK гагайе

The sentences are the following: ‘(My) uncle helped me build a house’, ‘(My) uncles helped me build a house’, ‘The fish (SG) ate the fly’, ‘The fish (PL) ate the flies’, ‘The river demolished the bridge’, ‘The rocks broke the roof’. In these maps the type (r-type or vowel-type) for each context is shown.
name: Индира

feature_description: Ergative marker can be of r-type (balʁu-ra fish.OBL-ERG) or of vowel-type (gagaj-e uncle-ERG). feature_description: Ergative marker can be of r-type (balʁu-ra fish.OBL-ERG) or of vowel-type (gagaj-e uncle-ERG). In each case the vowel in the marker can be present (balʁu-ra fish.OBL-ERG, gagaj-e uncle-ERG) or omitted (balʁu-r fish.OBL-ERG, gagaj-Ø uncle-ERG). This feature shows if the opposite variant of first reaction is possible. For example, speaker's first reaction was balʁu-ra (fish.OBL-ERG), then we asked if it is possible to say balʁu-r, or vice versa, speaker's first reaction was balʁu-r (fish.OBL-ERG), then we asked if it is possible to say balʁu-ra. If the opposite variant is possible, then we say there is a variation in vowel presence, if it is not possible, there is no variation. These maps show whether the variation in vowel presence is attested or not.

feature_description: Ergative marker can be of r-type (balʁu-ra fish.OBL-ERG) or of vowel-type (gagaj-e uncle-ERG). In each case the vowel in the marker can be present (balʁu-ra fish.OBL-ERG, gagaj-e uncle-ERG) or omitted (balʁu-r fish.OBL-ERG, gagaj-Ø uncle-ERG). This feature shows if the opposite variant of first reaction is possible. For example, speaker's first reaction was balʁu-ra (fish.OBL-ERG), then we asked if it is possible to say balʁu-r, or vice versa, speaker's first reaction was balʁu-r (fish.OBL-ERG), then we asked if it is possible to say balʁu-ra. If the opposite variant is possible, then we say there is a variation in vowel presence, if it is not possible, there is no variation. We collected 6 sentences with three nouns in singular and in plural: uncle.SG and uncle.PL (animate, human), fish.SG and fish.PL (animate, non-human), river.SG and rock.PL (inanimate, non-human). The sentences are the following: ‘(My) uncle helped me build a house’, ‘(My) uncles helped me build a house’, ‘The fish (SG) ate the fly’, ‘The fish (PL) ate the flies’, ‘The river demolished the bridge’, ‘The rocks broke the roof’. These maps show whether the variation in vowel presence is attested or not.
name: Тагир
schooling: Kufa до 4 класса, потом в Рутуле

feature_description: Ergative marker can be of r-type (balʁu-ra fish.OBL-ERG) or of vowel-type (gagaj-e uncle-ERG). In these maps the type (r-type or vowel-type) for each context is shown.
name: Тагир
schooling: Kufa до 4 класса, потом в Рутуле
answer: дядяра зас хал гьаъас куьмег' гьыъыр, гыгыйе зас хал гьаъас куьмег' гьыъыр, *гыгый
comment: гыгыйе зас хал гьаъас куьмег' гьыъыр, гыгый не бывает

We collected 6 sentences with three nouns in singular and in plural: uncle.SG and uncle.PL (animate, human), fish.SG and fish.PL (animate, non-human), river.SG and rock.PL (inanimate, non-human). The sentences are the following: ‘(My) uncle helped me build a house’, ‘(My) uncles helped me build a house’, ‘The fish (SG) ate the fly’, ‘The fish (PL) ate the flies’, ‘The river demolished the bridge’, ‘The rocks broke the roof’. In these maps the type (r-type or vowel-type) for each context is shown.
name: Халисат
comment: с е тоже идем, духлимер - мн.ч., духул - один, духлад хал

feature_description: Ergative marker can be of r-type (balʁu-ra fish.OBL-ERG) or of vowel-type (gagaj-e uncle-ERG). In each case the vowel in the marker can be present (balʁu-ra fish.OBL-ERG, gagaj-e uncle-ERG) or absent (balʁu-r fish.OBL-ERG, gagaj-Ø uncle-ERG). We collected 6 sentences with three nouns in singular and in plural: uncle.SG and uncle.PL (animate, human), fish.SG and fish.PL (animate, non-human), river.SG and rock.PL (inanimate, non-human). The sentences are the following: ‘(My) uncle helped me build a house’, ‘(My) uncles helped me build a house’, ‘The fish (SG) ate the fly’, ‘The fish (PL) ate the flies’, ‘The river demolished the bridge’, ‘The rocks broke the roof’. In these maps the presence of the vowel in ergative marker is shown in these 6 contexts.
name: Халисат
comment: с е тоже идем, духлимер - мн.ч., духул - один, духлад хал

feature_description: Ergative marker can be of r-type (balʁu-ra fish.OBL-ERG) or of vowel-type (gagaj-e uncle-ERG). In each case the vowel in the marker can be present (balʁu-ra fish.OBL-ERG, gagaj-e uncle-ERG) or omitted (balʁu-r fish.OBL-ERG, gagaj-Ø uncle-ERG). This feature shows if the opposite variant of first reaction is possible. For example, speaker's first reaction was balʁu-ra (fish.OBL-ERG), then we asked if it is possible to say balʁu-r, or vice versa, speaker's first reaction was balʁu-r (fish.OBL-ERG), then we asked if it is possible to say balʁu-ra. If the opposite variant is possible, then we say there is a variation in vowel presence, if it is not possible, there is no variation. We collected 6 sentences with three nouns in singular and in plural: uncle.SG and uncle.PL (animate, human), fish.SG and fish.PL (animate, non-human), river.SG and rock.PL (inanimate, non-human). The sentences are the following: ‘(My) uncle helped me build a house’, ‘(My) uncles helped me build a house’, ‘The fish (SG) ate the fly’, ‘The fish (PL) ate the flies’, ‘The river demolished the bridge’, ‘The rocks broke the roof’. These maps show whether the variation in vowel presence is attested or not.
name: Халисат
comment: с е тоже идем, духлимер - мн.ч., духул - один, духлад хал

feature_description: These maps show the comitative markers used in two contexts: ‘Rasul went hunting with a dog’ and ‘Rasul went to Makhachkala by car’. The markers attested are the following: -kʷan, -kan, -xʷan, -xan, -fan. The variants -kʷan and -kan are attested in Kina, Luchek, Amsar and Kiche, -fan — only in Ikhrek and Khnov, -xan — in Ikhrek and Rutul. And -xʷan is attested everywhere but Kina, Luchek and Khnov. The label OTHER is used if the comitative meaning is expressed not by means of a nominal marker, but a locative copula: χana, χan, xʷana.
name: Сара
stimuli: Расул пошел на охоту с собакой

The variants -kʷan and -kan are attested in Kina, Luchek, Amsar and Kiche, -fan — only in Ikhrek and Khnov, -xan — in Ikhrek and Rutul. And -xʷan is attested everywhere but Kina, Luchek and Khnov. The label OTHER is used if the comitative meaning is expressed not by means of a nominal marker, but a locative copula: χana, χan, xʷana.
name: эмираслан
long_periods_outside: ездит из города сюда, больше в селе жил
stimuli: Расул пошел на охоту с собакой

feature_description: These maps show what marker is used on a noun denoting locative relation ‛inside’: ‘in the house’ and ‘in the byre’. The markers can be following: -a (in case of a ‘hard’ stem, ‘house’), -e / -ä (‘soft’ stem, ‘byre’), and also in both cases the marker can be omitted, zero marking. The sentence, which were elicitated: ‘I am at home’ and ‘Cow is in the byre’.
name: Лейла

feature_description: Temporary possessor is a subject that holds some object, but do not owns it. We asked two contexts: ‘Do not search for your passport, I have it’ and ‘Who has a pen?’, where, respectfully the temporary possessors are ‘I’ and ‘who’. The first context is prototypical and this is how the forms of ‘me’ vary: zada, zadɨ (not to be confused with attributive form izdɨ, where the stem is different), zad and zadːa. It seems that the second context is less prototypical, and sometimes ‘who’ is marked not the same way as ‘me’, but the same as predicative possessor (see feature @): halɨχda. However, sometimes the marking resembles the marking for ‘me’: halda, haldɨ. These maps present the variation in these two contexts.
name: Лейла

We asked two contexts: ‘Do not search for your passport, I have it’ and ‘Who has a pen?’, where, respectfully the temporary possessors are ‘I’ and ‘who’. The first context is prototypical and this is how the forms of ‘me’ vary: zada, zadɨ (not to be confused with attributive form izdɨ, where the stem is different), zad and zadːa. It seems that the second context is less prototypical, and sometimes ‘who’ is marked not the same way as ‘me’, but the same as predicative possessor (see feature @): halɨχda. However, sometimes the marking resembles the marking for ‘me’: halda, haldɨ. These maps present the variation in these two contexts.
name: Айшат
stimuli: Не ищи свой паспорт, он у меня

We asked two contexts: ‘Do not search for your passport, I have it’ and ‘Who has a pen?’, where, respectfully the temporary possessors are ‘I’ and ‘who’. The first context is prototypical and this is how the forms of ‘me’ vary: zada, zadɨ (not to be confused with attributive form izdɨ, where the stem is different), zad and zadːa. It seems that the second context is less prototypical, and sometimes ‘who’ is marked not the same way as ‘me’, but the same as predicative possessor (see feature @): halɨχda. However, sometimes the marking resembles the marking for ‘me’: halda, haldɨ. These maps present the variation in these two contexts.
name: тажир
long_periods_outside: учился в дербенте, работал в бабаюртовском районе. но с 86 года тут
